markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 7"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Scholastic Identification](/Feats.aspx?ID=1882) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 156 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Archaeologist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=46)

**Prerequisites**
[Archaeologist Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1879); Master in [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)

</column>

---

You have the knowledge needed to understand ancient texts and cultural artifacts. You can use [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) when [Deciphering Writing](/Actions.aspx?ID=22), no matter the type of writing you are examining. You can also use Society to [Identify Magic](/Actions.aspx?ID=24) when examining a magic item or location with cultural significance.
name: Scholastic Identification
